nodes.bodyText: Let's add package private getters for these collections and make the fields private. Perhaps add _DEFS suffixes to the variable names for clarity.
I think we still need a check here to make sure the user is not trying to make a tag definition with a tag name already used by the one of the standard tag definitions.
By removing this altogether are we now allowing deletion of tags when ingest is running where we were not permitting this before?
In TagNameDefinition, we have the default Project VIC tag set name as a localizable string, where it is just hard-coded here.
We only want to fire one tag added event, with the added tag as the newValue and the list of deleted tags as the oldValue. Other wise we will trigger multiple GUI refreshes, etc.
See comment on this method in Jira.
Is this perhaps a leftover from when we thought we were going to localize these?

nodes.bodyText: It would be better to not hand out a reference to the internal data structure. The TagName objects are immutable, but the  collections are not.

      * Gets tag name definitions from the tag settings file as well as the
      * default tag name definitions.
      *
+     * The currently custom tags properties are stored in one string property
+     * value separated by ;. The properties of an individual tag are comma
+     * separated in the format of:
+     * tag_name,tag_description,tag_color,known_status
+     *
+     * In prior versions of autopsy the known_status was stored in the central
+     * repository, therefore the properties file only had three values.
+     *
